programme.title: Nhk Newsline
NHK NEWSLINE/ＮＨＫワールド ＪＡＰＡＮ
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPANのメインニュース番組。毎日毎正時から、日本・アジアを中心に世界の最新ニュース、経済情報、気象情報などを伝える。
programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: The Musical Diplomat
日韓友情コンサート/ＮＨＫワールド ＪＡＰＡＮ
programme.desc: ＮＨＫワールド ＪＡＰＡＮを放送しています。詳しくはホームページをご覧ください。 nhk.jp/nhkworld
programme.title: The Musical Diplomat
programme.desc: Renowned pianist Lee Kyung-mi uses her talent to foster better ties between Japan and South Korea. We trace her journey, from childhood to sharing the stage with special friends this year in Seoul.
programme.title: The Musical Diplomat: Playing a Bridge for Two Countries
programme.desc: Renowned pianist Lee Kyung-mi uses her talent to foster better ties between Japan and South Korea.

programme.title: Newsroom Tokyo
NEWSROOM TOKYO/ＮＨＫワールド ＪＡＰＡＮ
programme.desc: 平日夜に日本とアジアの１日の動きをせきとめ、中継やリポートを軸に、専門家や取材記者の解説を交えて、深く分かりやすくニュースを伝えます。
programme.title: NEWSROOM TOKYO
programme.desc: NEWSROOM TOKYO dives deeper into the day's news with insight and analysis, from the perspective of Japan and the rest of Asia. We put a spotlight on what you need to know to understand the issues.

programme.title: Direct Talk
Direct Talk/ＮＨＫワールド ＪＡＰＡＮ
programme.desc: 第一線で活躍するビジネスマンや芸術家など社会的に影響力のある人々の声を紹介するインタビュー番組。
programme.title: Direct Talk #199
programme.desc: Makihara Daizoh is drawing attention from around the world for crafting timepieces that embody a Japanese aesthetic. He talks about the appeal of analog watchmaking in the digital age.
programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.sub-title: The Beauty and Art of Watchmaking

programme.title: Dosukoi Sumo Salon 5 Minutes
NHK WORLD SELECTION/ＮＨＫワールド ＪＡＰＡＮ
programme.desc: ＮＨＫワールド ＪＡＰＡＮを放送しています。詳しくはホームページをご覧ください。 nhk.jp/nhkworld
programme.title: DOSUKOI Sumo Salon 5 minutes
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN presents a variety of short programs focusing on Japan and Asia.
programme.title: DOSUKOI Sumo Salon
programme.desc: This technique has been used in clutch moments in some historic bouts. We learn how it's different from the overarm throw and hear secrets of how it's done from the masters!

programme.title: Ukiyoe Edo-Life(1)
Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE(3)/ＮＨＫワールド ＪＡＰＡＮ
programme.desc: ＮＨＫワールド ＪＡＰＡＮを放送しています。詳しくはホームページをご覧ください。 nhk.jp/nhkworld
programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE: Bustling Scenes of Old Tokyo(1)
programme.desc: Discover story behind the "36 Views of Mt. Fuji" woodprint series; "The Great Wave off Kanagawa" by Hokusai. It is not just a huge wave and Mt. Fuji, the boat caught in the wave have a reason.
programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE
programme.sub-title: The Great Wave off Kanagawa by Katsushika Hokusai

programme.title: Hometown Stories
Hometown Stories/ＮＨＫワールド ＪＡＰＡＮ
programme.desc: 日本各地の暮らしや文化、風土、人物に焦点をあてたドキュメンタリー番組。
programme.title: Hometown Stories
programme.desc: Koyama Rie was diagnosed with Parkinson's disease several years ago. An avid table-tennis player, she now teaches the sport to fellow Parkinson's patients to improve their health and their outlook.

programme.title: Satoyama Kitchen Spring #4
Easy Japanese/ＮＨＫワールド ＪＡＰＡＮ
programme.desc: NHKワールド JAPAN（ラジオ）の多言語コンテンツで、アジアなどで人気の「やさしい日本語」を映像化し、日本語学習番組へのニーズに応える。
programme.title: Satoyama Kitchen Spring
programme.desc: At the Satoyama Kitchen guesthouse in Hida Takayama, chef Nobuko, her cameraman husband Makoto and their cat Tama take us on a tasty journey of local cuisine served with a side of seasonal scenery.
programme.title: Satoyama Kitchen Diary
programme.sub-title: Field Work Fueled by Leaf-wrapped Sushi
programme.desc: Hi, it's me, Tama! When I saw a rainbow this morning, I got the feeling there'd be something yummy for me today, and I was right! Grandma Nobuko and Grandpa Makoto are making leaf- wrapped sushi. I can't wait!

programme.title: Japanology Plus
Japanology Plus/ＮＨＫワールド ＪＡＰＡＮ
programme.desc: 富士山からラーメンまで、多面的な日本の魅力を紹介する『ジャパノロジー・プラス』。各ジャンルの専門家とともにピーター・バラカンがお伝えします。
programme.title: Japanology Plus
programme.desc: French journalist and "sento ambassador" Stephanie Crohin promotes sento, or public bathhouses, on social media. She tells Peter Barakan about her love for the heartwarming world of public baths.

*First broadcast on September 26, 2024. French journalist and "sento ambassador" Stephanie Crohin promotes sento, or public bathhouses, on social media. She tells Peter Barakan about her love for the heartwarming world of public baths.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
Japan Railway Journal
Japan Railway Journal/ＮＨＫワールド ＪＡＰＡＮ
programme.desc: 新幹線をはじめとした日本の速くて安全な鉄道技術を海外に発信するとともに、熱心な欧米の鉄道ファンが来日した時に楽しめる、日本の最新鉄道情報番組です。
programme.title: Japan Railway Journal
programme.desc: Iwate Prefecture is home to a number of unique railways and popular tourist trains. See the different initiatives JR and Iwate Prefecture are taking to increase railway tourism.
Iwate Prefecture is home to a number of unique railways and popular tourist trains. See the different initiatives JR and Iwate are taking to increase railway tourism.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
Core Kyoto
Core Kyoto/ＮＨＫワールド ＪＡＰＡＮ
programme.desc: 四季の自然と絢爛たる伝統、そして新たな創造を続けてきた千年の都、京都。その奥深い魅力を極上の映像で綴る「魅惑の京都・決定版」。
programme.title: Core Kyoto
programme.desc: This 11th-century novel is set in the imperial court. As a work of literature and paintings, it captured people's hearts, profoundly influencing the culture of the ancient capital for a millennium.
programme.sub-title: The Tale of Genji: Elegance That Transcends the Ages

programme.title: Asia Insight
Outside In: Lost in Academia
programme.desc: Japanese culture is in the global spotlight like never before. Dive into the work of international scholars exploring Japan in bold, original ways, uncovering unique perspectives and deep insights.
programme.title: Outside in Lost in Academia
programme.desc: Japan's snack bars are a unique form of nightlife. Harvard-trained anthropologist Maura McGrath's research reveals a fascinating look into this world. What secrets do they hold?

programme.sub-title: The Hui: Muslim Merchants Thriving in China
programme.desc: In Yiwu, China, the Muslim Hui people expand trade with Arab countries using their Arabic language skills. They are becoming an essential presence as China shifts away from US trade and diversifies.

programme.desc: A group of well-loved shrines, with branches all across Japan, are affectionately known by the nickname of Tenjin-sama. programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE: Bustling Scenes of Old Tokyo(2)
Ukiyoe Edo-Life
programme.desc: Centuries ago, Tokyo was known as Edo. More than a million people enjoyed life in this small but abundant city. They live on in ukiyo-e woodblock prints. Each episode is a deep dive into a single print, and an exploration of the soul of Old Tokyo. We examine works by artists like Hokusai and Hiroshige not just for their aesthetic and historical value, but for the stories they tell of everyday life. That is how the people of Edo themselves enjoyed this mass-produced medium.

TAKE TECH is an educational program for children from upper elementary school to high school designed to foster familiarity with everyday technology. The focus is technology we depend on in our daily lives, such as products found in people's homes, information systems and machines. Why were they created, and how do they work? Each episode features one key tech and explains its mechanism and function in an easy-to-understand way.

In September, 11 districts in Yatsuo in Toyama Prefecture parade along different routes performing Etchu Owara-Kaze-no-Bon, a 300-year-old matsuri that features elegant music, dancing, and singing.

Etchu Owara-Kaze-no-Bon is a 300-year-old matsuri held in Yatsuo, Toyama Prefecture. Eleven neighborhoods choose their own routes, dances and parade styles, all of which feature elegant music, dancing and singing. Originally a prayer for bountiful harvests and lasting prosperity, it is a community event in which only local people dance and perform. With the threat of COVID-19 receding, the festival went ahead in 2022 for the first time in three years, to the great delight of Yatsuo residents.

programme.title: Bosai:Disaster Response Robots
Bosai: Science That Can Save Your Life
programme.desc: When disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people trapped under rubble, while fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear accidents may bar entry entirely. That's where disaster response robots can help.
programme.title: BOSAI
BOSAI - Science that Can Save Your Life
BOSAI:Disaster Response Robots/ＮＨＫワールド ＪＡＰＡＮ
programme.desc: ＮＨＫワールド ＪＡＰＡＮを放送しています。詳しくはホームページをご覧ください。 nhk.jp/nhkworld

Japan has a long history of natural disasters. BOSAI explores how to overcome them and save lives with the power of science. When disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people trapped under rubble, while fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear accidents may bar entry entirely. That's where disaster response robots can help.
programme.title: BOSAI:Disaster Response Robots
programme.desc: When disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people trapped under rubble, while fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear accidents may bar entry entirely. Thats where disaster response robots can help.
programme.title: BOSAI: Disaster Response Robots
programme.desc: The Great East Japan Earthquake in 2011 and its resulting tsunami caused the accident at the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant. The worst nuclear accident in Japan's history suffered from a lack of information due to the inaccessibility of the reactor buildings. For this reason, "disaster response robots" were deployed to take pictures and measure radiation doses inside the buildings.
programme.title: BOSAI: Disaster Response Robots
programme.desc: Disaster Response Robots: If disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people if fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear accidents prevent smooth recovery - that's where robots can help.

The Great East Japan Earthquake in 2011 and its resulting tsunami caused the accident at the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant. The worst nuclear accident in Japan's history suffered from a lack of information due to the inaccessibility of the reactor buildings. For this reason, "disaster response robots" were deployed to take pictures and measure radiation doses inside the buildings. In the aftermath of a major disaster like that as well as an earthquake or fire, robots can quickly enter dangerous sites that are inaccessible to humans, find people in need of rescue, and take detailed measurements to provide data about the site. In this episode, we'll look at the latest developments among Japan's "disaster response robots."
programme.title: BOSAI
programme.desc: Cuando ocurre una catástrofe natural, puede ser difícil encontrar a las personas atrapadas debajo de los escombros. Es ahí donde los robots de respuesta ante desastres, pueden ser de gran ayuda.

programme.desc: This time, we will focus on the living art of Bonsai. What is behind the art of cultivating trees into aesthetically pleasing shapes in containers rather than allowing nature to take its course?

The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode focuses on words related to kage, meaning both shadow and shade. From rooting for someone working toward their dreams, to expressing appreciation for those around you, words involving kage are surprisingly common in daily conversation. From his home in Kyoto Prefecture, poet and literary translator Peter MacMillan guides us through such unique words and the culture behind them.

programme.title: TAKE TECH
programme.desc: TAKE TECH is an educational program for children from upper elementary school to high school designed to foster familiarity with everyday technology. The focus is technology we depend on in our daily lives, such as products found in people's homes, information systems and machines. Why were they created, and how do they work? Each episode features one key tech and explains its mechanism and function in an easy-to-understand way.
programme.title: Matsuri: The Heartbeat of Japan - Season 1, Episode 1
MATSURI
programme.desc: Traditional festivals called matsuri are found all over Japan. In this series, we present diverse matsuri and the preparations leading up to them. Each matsuri presents a new face of local Japan. In September, 11 districts in Yatsuo, Toyama Prefecture parade along different routes performing Etchu Owara-Kaze-no-Bon, a 300-year-old matsuri that features elegant music, dancing, and singing.
Traditional festivals called matsuri are found all over Japan. In this series, we present diverse matsuri and the preparations leading up to them. Each matsuri presents a new face of local Japan.
In September, 11 districts in Yatsuo in Toyama Prefecture parade along different routes performing Etchu Owara-Kaze-no-Bon, a 300-year-old matsuri that features elegant music, dancing, and singing.

Etchu Owara-Kaze-no-Bon is a 300-year-old matsuri held in Yatsuo, Toyama Prefecture. Eleven neighborhoods choose their own routes, dances and parade styles, all of which feature elegant music, dancing and singing. Originally a prayer for bountiful harvests and lasting prosperity, it is a community event in which only local people dance and perform. With the threat of COVID-19 receding, the festival went ahead in 2022 for the first time in three years, to the great delight of Yatsuo residents.

programme.title: Bosai:Disaster Response Robots
Bosai: Science That Can Save Your Life
programme.desc: When disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people trapped under rubble, while fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear accidents may bar entry entirely. That's where disaster response robots can help.
programme.title: BOSAI
BOSAI - Science that Can Save Your Life
BOSAI:Disaster Response Robots/ＮＨＫワールド ＪＡＰＡＮ

Japan has a long history of natural disasters. BOSAI explores how to overcome them and save lives with the power of science. When disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people trapped under rubble, while fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear accidents may bar entry entirely. That's where disaster response robots can help.
programme.title: BOSAI:Disaster Response Robots
programme.desc: When disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people trapped under rubble, while fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear accidents may bar entry entirely. Thats where disaster response robots can help.
programme.title: BOSAI: Disaster Response Robots
programme.desc: The Great East Japan Earthquake in 2011 and its resulting tsunami caused the accident at the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant. The worst nuclear accident in Japan's history suffered from a lack of information due to the inaccessibility of the reactor buildings. For this reason, "disaster response robots" were deployed to take pictures and measure radiation doses inside the buildings.
programme.title: BOSAI: Disaster Response Robots
programme.desc: Disaster Response Robots: If disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people if fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear accidents prevent smooth recovery - that's where robots can help.

The Great East Japan Earthquake in 2011 and its resulting tsunami caused the accident at the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant. The worst nuclear accident in Japan's history suffered from a lack of information due to the inaccessibility of the reactor buildings. For this reason, "disaster response robots" were deployed to take pictures and measure radiation doses inside the buildings. In the aftermath of a major disaster like that as well as an earthquake or fire, robots can quickly enter dangerous sites that are inaccessible to humans, find people in need of rescue, and take detailed measurements to provide data about the site. In this episode, we'll look at the latest developments among Japan's "disaster response robots."

programme.desc: This time, we will focus on the living art of Bonsai. What is behind the art of cultivating trees into aesthetically pleasing shapes in containers rather than allowing nature to take its course?

16th-century samurai fought over a divided Japan. Takeda Shingen was one of the strongest. Known for fast cavalry, stealthy ninja warriors, and unmatched political skill, he still has wisdom to share. Painted as a foolish ruler in works of fiction, fifth Tokugawa Shogun, Tsunayoshi. But is this depiction justified? Even he has wisdom to share.
With flashy armor and cunning tactics, samurai Maeda Toshiie struck fear in the heart of Shogun Tokugawa Ieyasu and left a lasting cultural influence.

The Manyoshu is the oldest extant anthology of Japanese poetry. Through poems presented in both manga and modern settings, we glimpse sentiments from centuries ago. The topic this time is love. The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history, and culture. This episode looks at words related to shadow or shade. Explore the unique culture behind them.
Explore the richness and depth of the Japanese language and discover how words and expressions reflect history, culture and the natural world.

The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode focuses on words related to kage, meaning both shadow and shade. From rooting for someone working toward their dreams, to expressing appreciation for those around you, words involving kage are surprisingly common in daily conversation. From his home in Kyoto Prefecture, poet and literary translator Peter MacMillan guides us through such unique words and the culture behind them.

programme.title: Matsuri: The Heartbeat Of Japan
Matsuri: The Heartbeat Of Japan
programme.desc: In September, 11 districts in Yatsuo, Toyama Prefecture parade along different routes performing Etchu Owara-Kaze-no-Bon, a 300-year-old matsuri that features elegant music, dancing, and singing.
programme.title: Matsuri: The Heartbeat of Japan - Season 1, Episode 1
MATSURI
programme.desc: Traditional festivals called matsuri are found all over Japan. In this series, we present diverse matsuri and the preparations leading up to them. Each matsuri presents a new face of local Japan. In September, 11 districts in Yatsuo, Toyama Prefecture parade along different routes performing Etchu Owara-Kaze-no-Bon, a 300-year-old matsuri that features elegant music, dancing, and singing.
Traditional festivals called matsuri are found all over Japan. In this series, we present diverse matsuri and the preparations leading up to them. Each matsuri presents a new face of local Japan.
In September, 11 districts in Yatsuo in Toyama Prefecture parade along different routes performing Etchu Owara-Kaze-no-Bon, a 300-year-old matsuri that features elegant music, dancing, and singing.

Etchu Owara-Kaze-no-Bon is a 300-year-old matsuri held in Yatsuo, Toyama Prefecture. Eleven neighborhoods choose their own routes, dances and parade styles, all of which feature elegant music, dancing and singing. Originally a prayer for bountiful harvests and lasting prosperity, it is a community event in which only local people dance and perform. With the threat of COVID-19 receding, the festival went ahead in 2022 for the first time in three years, to the great delight of Yatsuo residents.

programme.title: BOSAI
programme.desc: When disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people trapped under rubble, while fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear accidents may bar entry entirely. That's where disaster response robots can help.
programme.title: Bosai: Science That Can Save Your Life
BOSAI - Science that Can Save Your Life
BOSAI:Disaster Response Robots/ＮＨＫワールド ＪＡＰＡＮ
programme.desc: ＮＨＫワールド ＪＡＰＡＮを放送しています。詳しくはホームページをご覧ください。 nhk.jp/nhkworld

Japan has a long history of natural disasters. BOSAI explores how to overcome them and save lives with the power of science. When disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people trapped under rubble, while fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear accidents may bar entry entirely. That's where disaster response robots can help.
programme.title: BOSAI:Disaster Response Robots
programme.desc: When disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people trapped under rubble, while fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear accidents may bar entry entirely. Thats where disaster response robots can help.
programme.title: BOSAI: Disaster Response Robots
programme.desc: The Great East Japan Earthquake in 2011 and its resulting tsunami caused the accident at the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant. The worst nuclear accident in Japan's history suffered from a lack of information due to the inaccessibility of the reactor buildings. For this reason, "disaster response robots" were deployed to take pictures and measure radiation doses inside the buildings.
programme.title: BOSAI: Disaster Response Robots
programme.desc: Disaster Response Robots: If disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people if fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear accidents prevent smooth recovery - that's where robots can help.

The Great East Japan Earthquake in 2011 and its resulting tsunami caused the accident at the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant. The worst nuclear accident in Japan's history suffered from a lack of information due to the inaccessibility of the reactor buildings. For this reason, "disaster response robots" were deployed to take pictures and measure radiation doses inside the buildings. In the aftermath of a major disaster like that as well as an earthquake or fire, robots can quickly enter dangerous sites that are inaccessible to humans, find people in need of rescue, and take detailed measurements to provide data about the site. In this episode, we'll look at the latest developments among Japan's "disaster response robots."
programme.title: Bosai: An Educational Journey
programme.desc: This time, we will focus on the living art of Bonsai. What is behind the art of cultivating trees into aesthetically pleasing shapes in containers rather than allowing nature to take its course?
programme.title: BOSAI: Science that Can Save Your Life

BOSAI - Science that Can Save Your Life
programme.desc: Japan has a long history of natural disasters. BOSAI explores how to overcome them and save lives with the power of science. When disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people trapped under rubble, while fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear accidents may bar entry entirely. That's where disaster response robots can help.
programme.title: BOSAI: Disaster Response Robots
programme.desc: The Great East Japan Earthquake in 2011 and its resulting tsunami caused the accident at the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant. The worst nuclear accident in Japan's history suffered from a lack of information due to the inaccessibility of the reactor buildings. For this reason, "disaster response robots" were deployed to take pictures and measure radiation doses inside the buildings.
programme.title: BOSAI: Disaster Response Robots
programme.desc: Disaster Response Robots: If disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people if fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear accidents prevent smooth recovery - that's where robots can help.

The Great East Japan Earthquake in 2011 and its resulting tsunami caused the accident at the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant. The worst nuclear accident in Japan's history suffered from a lack of information due to the inaccessibility of the reactor buildings. For this reason, "disaster response robots" were deployed to take pictures and measure radiation doses inside the buildings. In the aftermath of a major disaster like that as well as an earthquake or fire, robots can quickly enter dangerous sites that are inaccessible to humans, find people in need of rescue, and take detailed measurements to provide data about the site. In this episode, we'll look at the latest developments among Japan's "disaster response robots."

programme.desc: This time, we will focus on the living art of Bonsai. What is behind the art of cultivating trees into aesthetically pleasing shapes in containers rather than allowing nature to take its course?

programme.title: Magical Japanese
programme.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode focuses on words related to kage, meaning both shadow and shade. From rooting for someone working toward their dreams, to expressing appreciation for those around you, words involving kage are surprisingly common in daily conversation. From his home in Kyoto Prefecture, poet and literary translator Peter MacMillan guides us through such unique words and the culture behind them.

programme.title: Matsuri: The Heartbeat of Japan - Season 1, Episode 1
MATSURI
programme.desc: Traditional festivals called matsuri are found all over Japan. In this series, we present diverse matsuri and the preparations leading up to them. Each matsuri presents a new face of local Japan. In September, 11 districts in Yatsuo, Toyama Prefecture parade along different routes performing Etchu Owara-Kaze-no-Bon, a 300-year-old matsuri that features elegant music, dancing, and singing.
Traditional festivals called matsuri are found all over Japan. In this series, we present diverse matsuri and the preparations leading up to them. Each matsuri presents a new face of local Japan.
programme.title: Matsuri: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: In September, 11 districts in Yatsuo in Toyama Prefecture parade along different routes performing Etchu Owara-Kaze-no-Bon, a 300-year-old matsuri that features elegant music, dancing, and singing.

Etchu Owara-Kaze-no-Bon is a 300-year-old matsuri held in Yatsuo, Toyama Prefecture. Eleven neighborhoods choose their own routes, dances and parade styles, all of which feature elegant music, dancing and singing. Originally a prayer for bountiful harvests and lasting prosperity, it is a community event in which only local people dance and perform. With the threat of COVID-19 receding, the festival went ahead in 2022 for the first time in three years, to the great delight of Yatsuo residents.

programme.title: A Cat's-Eye View of Japan
programme.desc: A unique trip around the country of Japan with photographer and filmmaker Iwago Mitsuaki, discovering the uncharted charms and customs of regions, all seen through the eyes of cats.
Tokyo is home to many lucky cats called "maneki-neko!" Get your kitty fix at a public bath, a lantern shop, and a classical theater. Then, meet them after hours in Shinjuku's Golden Gai bar district!

programme.desc: El fotógrafo Iwago Mitsuaki viaja por todo el mundo para ofrecer una amplia colección de imágenes de gatos y así descubrir los encantos y costumbres menos conocidas de las regiones de Japón a traves de esos ojos felinos.

Puppet action show for young children, produced for utilization in moral education classes in schools in Japan. In a distant post-human future where surviving creatures have formed a community, new-breed dinosaur girl Rockie sets out on hilarious adventures with her schoolmates.

Rockie contemplates what gift she should give her teacher Ms. Hippo on her birthday, but as she gets lost in her thoughts she fails to respond to her buddies greeting her. Educational theme: The merit of greeting each other pleasantly.
programme.title: Rockie and Her Friends

programme.desc: Miyashita Homei discusses his invention, an electrified spoon that imparts a salty taste to foods. This technology is designed to help those on special diets by satisfying their palates.

programme.title: Easy Japanese for Work

Pointing out a senior coworker's mistake. Kyaw Swar Aung, from Myanmar, works behind the scenes at Narita Airport. He'll tackle a roleplay challenge in which he notices a senior worker's mistake.
programme.sub-title: #40 Pointing out a senior coworker's mistake
programme.desc: Today: pointing out a senior coworker's mistake. Kyaw Swar Aung, from Myanmar, works behind the scenes at Narita Airport. He carries out tasks such as guiding aircraft as well as loading and unloading baggage. He's learned that both caution and precision are necessary to prevent accidents. He knows to report anything out of the ordinary, as well as any errors. He'll tackle a roleplay challenge in which he notices a senior worker's mistake. How will he handle the situation?
programme.title: Easy Japanese for Work
programme.desc: Habilidades aceleradas para el idioma japonés. Una forma práctica de aprender expresiones ideales para el ámbito laboral.

programme.title: Zero Waste Life
programme.desc: Okinawa is home to Ryukyu Glass, a local industry for over 100 years. Matsumoto Sakae uses discarded bottles to make things to be loved and never again thrown away, doing his part to reduce waste.
Meet people around Japan who strive for a life without waste under the traditional philosophy of "MOTTAINAI," which values cherishing the things we have.
Okinawa is home to "Ryukyu Glass," a local industry for over 100 years. Matsumoto Sakae uses discarded bottles to make things to be loved and never again thrown away, doing his part to reduce waste.

The Japanese southern island of Okinawa Prefecture, warm all year, this popular tourist spot is home to "Ryukyu Glass," a local industry for over 100 years. Glass blower Matsumoto Sakae insists on using discarded bottles as raw material. He says their status as trash inspires him to give them beauty, making things that will be loved and never again thrown away. programme.title: On the Wings
programme.desc: Join us on a night flight to admire Japan's stunning views on a journey from Tokyo to Fukuoka. Behold the sublime beauty of Mt. Fuji at sunset and the sparkling night views of major cities.

programme.title: Let's enjoy Math with Barky the Dog
programme.desc: Children wish to share a cake, but are confused when Numbler cuts the cake into different shapes. Barky uses the basics of fractions and geometry to prove that the pieces are indeed equal.

programme.title: TAKE TECH
programme.desc: TAKE TECH is an educational program for children from upper elementary school to high school designed to foster familiarity with everyday technology. The focus is technology we depend on in our daily lives, such as products found in people's homes, information systems and machines. Why were they created, and how do they work? Each episode features one key tech and explains its mechanism and function in an easy-to-understand way.

programme.title: Design Museum Japan
programme.desc: Yamanashi / Shibata Fumie (product designer) "Kaiki" is a thin, brightly colored silk fabric. Shibata discovers how threads are arranged to produce a layered effect that resembles a digital image.

programme.title: Magical Japanese
programme.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history, and culture. This episode looks at words related to shadow or shade. Explore the unique culture behind them.

programme.title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: In September, 11 districts in Yatsuo, Toyama Prefecture parade along different routes performing Etchu Owara-Kaze-no-Bon, a 300-year-old matsuri that features elegant music, dancing, and singing.

programme.title: On the Wings 5min.

programme.title: Bosai: An Educational Journey
programme.desc: When disaster strikes, it can be hard to find people trapped under rubble, while fire, volcanic eruption, or nuclear accidents may bar entry entirely. That's where disaster response robots can help.

programme.title: [4K]美の壺「京の味 秋」[字][再]
programme.desc: 京都で季節の美味を楽しむ「京の味」シリーズの秋編！嵐山の「会席料理」から、老舗料亭こだわりの旬と名残り、京都の「すし」、「丹波栗」の味わい方まで秋の味を大紹介！

programme.title: [4K]【連続テレビ小説】どんど晴れ（１８）「おもてなしの心」[解][字]
programme.desc: 盛岡での仲居修業をはじめた夏美は、失敗を重ねながらも持ち前の明るさで仕事を覚えていく。しかし、夏美の不手際が原因で客が怪我をしてしまい、夏美は窮地に立たされる。

programme.title: [4K]【連続テレビ小説】ばけばけ第５週ワタシ、ヘブン。マツエ、モ、ヘブン。２２[解][字][再]

programme.title: [4K]【連続テレビ小説】ばけばけ第５週ワタシ、ヘブン。マツエ、モ、ヘブン。２３[解][字][再]
programme.desc: 神々の国の首都・松江で迎えた朝景色にヘブン（トミー・バストウ）は感動を覚える。一方、トキ（ 石あかり）はなみ（さとうほなみ）から、ヘブンにお使いを頼まれる。

programme.title: [4K]【連続テレビ小説】ばけばけ第５週ワタシ、ヘブン。マツエ、モ、ヘブン。２４[解][字][再]

programme.title: [4K]【連続テレビ小説】ばけばけ第５週ワタシ、ヘブン。マツエ、モ、ヘブン。２５[解][字][再]

programme.desc: １９４２年８月。ドイツの爆撃機がソ連のスターリングラードを破壊する。廃墟が狙撃や白兵戦の場と化し、過酷なロシアの冬が疲弊した兵士たちに襲いかかる。【二ヶ国語】
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: メーデー！１８：航空機事故の真実と真相「アイレス航空８２５０便」[二]
programme.desc: ２０１０年８月１６日。ボゴタからサン・アンドレスに向かうアイレス航空８２５０便は目的地手前で熱帯暴風雨に遭遇。そして最終進入中に滑走路手前の地面に衝突した。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 検証！中国の歴史ミステリー「万里の長城の謎」[字]
programme.desc: 考古学者アラン・マカが地球最大の人工構造物、中国の万里の長城を調査する。最新の衛星画像と最先端テクノロジーによって、この古代遺跡の謎がついに明らかになる。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 仰天！運び屋ｖｓ取締屋ｉｎ全米エアポート ６「トランクの中のブツ」[二]
programme.desc: サンディエゴで捜査局により麻薬取引が阻止され、大量の麻薬が押収される。フィラデルフィア国際空港では、取締官たちが未申告の品物や現金の持ち込みを摘発していく。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 仰天！運び屋ｖｓ取締屋ｉｎ全米エアポート ２「摘発、毒入りチョリソー？」[二]
programme.desc: 全世界を襲った新型コロナウィルスの影響で空路の利用客が激減すると、陸路での密輸が増加していく。改造されたトラックから過去最大規模の違法薬物の押収に成功する。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: ●土曜ミステリーファイル●甦る！アンコールに眠る財宝〜古代ラオスの秘密[二]
programme.desc: 「クメールの財宝」ラオスで発見された古代文明の財宝。調査を進めると、クメール帝国の礎を築いた初期の王との繋がりが。古代文明の起源に迫る。声：渡辺真理
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: ●土曜ミステリーファイル●仰天！海の底まる見え検証 ６「蜜蝋の難破船」[二]
programme.desc: ３００年以上、アメリカ先住民族の間で語り継がれてきた難破船の噂。海岸に漂着し続ける蜜蝋の謎を追うと、オレゴンの海に沈んでいるとされる巨大な船の正体が明らかになる
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: ●土曜ミステリーファイル●仰天！海の底まる見え検証 ６「禁酒法時代の密輸船」
programme.desc: ２０世紀初頭にアメリカを支配したマフィアは、どのようにして富と権力を得たのか。各地で発見された船やトラックから、暗躍したマフィアの真実が明らかになる【二ヶ国語】
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: ●土曜ミステリーファイル●コロッセオ：死闘の娯楽とローマ帝国 声：細谷佳正[二]
programme.desc: 「巨大闘技場の新興」ローマ帝国に築かれた最大の建造物コロッセオの起源をひもとこう。イタリア各地に出向き、コロッセオと、剣闘士の闘技会の成り立ちを解き明かすのだ。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 潜入：アングラな闇組織を暴け！２「詐欺の都市」[字]
programme.desc: ある人身売買の映像を見たマリアナは、タイ・ミャンマー国境付近へ。豚の屠殺という新たな詐欺の実態を知るべく、不穏なうわさが広がる新興都市シュエコッコに潜入する。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 密着！マドリード・バラハス空港警察「コカイン密輸の摘発」[二]
programme.desc: アドルフォ・スアレス・マドリード・バラハス空港では、警察が常に目を光らせている。車いすの男性の荷物からコカイン２０キロが見つかり、空港職員の関与が疑われるが…。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 衝撃！ワースト１０ 世界の重大インシデント「探検中の事故」声：井上麻里奈[二]
programme.desc: 探検中に起きた事故をランキング形式で紹介。タイの洞窟に閉じ込められたサッカーチームや謎の文明を探してアマゾンで消息を絶った調査隊。その明暗を分けたものとは？
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: メーデー！１４：航空機事故の真実と真相「コンチネンタル・エクスプレス２２８６便」
programme.desc: デンバーを離陸したコンチネンタル・エクスプレス２２８６便がデュランゴに着陸しようとして空港手前の凍った荒野に墜落。救助活動が行われ事故調査が始まる。【二ヶ国語】
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: メーデー！６：航空機事故の真実と真相「パンナム１０３便」[二]
programme.desc: ２００８年制作／１９８８年１２月、パンナム１０３便がスコットランドのロッカービー上空で爆発した。乗員乗客２５９人と住人１１人が死亡。機には爆弾が仕掛けられていた
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: メーデー！１４：航空機事故の真実と真相「ナショナル・エアラインズ１０２便」[二]
programme.desc: ボーイング７４７を改造したナショナル・エアラインズ１０２便が軍需物資を積んでバグラム空軍基地を離陸した。その数秒後、機体は突然コントロールを失い地面に激突する。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 仰天！運び屋ｖｓ取締屋ｉｎ全米エアポート ２「ダークウェブと液体薬物」[二]
programme.desc: 近年、コロンビアから液体で薬物が持ち込まれるケースが増加しているという。一方、ダークウェブで購入されたと思われる薬物が見つかり、捜査に乗り出すことに。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: ハリケーン・カトリーナ：社会を引き裂いた大災害「絶望的な避難所」[字]
programme.desc: 家屋に閉じ込められた数千人の救助活動が続く中、多くの人がスーパードームに避難している。暴力行為ばかり報道するメディアの中で、力強く生きる人たちの話が聞こえてくる
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 獣医ミシェルの日常 ９「牛のボート移送」[二]
programme.desc: 牛をボートに乗せて移送するため、コディアック島にやってきたミシェル。麻酔銃を撃って眠らせ、積み下ろしするのもひと苦労だ。しかも復路ではアクシデントに見舞われる。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 【Ｄｒ．ポール・ハロウィーン】スゴ腕どうぶつドクター４「血まみれのハロウィーン」
programme.desc: ●モーニング・Ｄｒ．ポール●ハロウィーンの準備に追われるポール動物病院。それでも続々と患畜は訪れる。今回は一筋縄ではいかないケースばかりだ。【二ヶ国語】
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 【Ｄｒ．ポール・ハロウィーン】スゴ腕どうぶつドクター５[二]
programme.desc: ●モーニング・Ｄｒ．ポール●「ドクター・フランケンポール」首を噛まれてフランケンシュタインのようになった子犬、そしてコスチューム…戦慄と涙のハロウィーン特集！
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 中国大運河の旅[字]
programme.desc: 中国の北京から杭州を結ぶ大運河は古代の人々の移動や商いの方法を変えた。番組では写真家のジェフ・ハッチェンスが旅をしながら大運河がもたらしたものを探っていく。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: スゴ腕どうぶつドクター２「母は偉大なり」[二]
programme.desc: 毎日が新鮮なこの仕事がポールは大好きだ。忙しい一週間が終わり、一家は母の日を祝う。仕事に専念できるのも、家族がハッピーでいられるのも全てダイアンのおかげなのだ。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: スゴ腕どうぶつドクター４「ドクター・ブレンダ大活躍」[二]
programme.desc: ドクター・ブレンダはポール動物病院で働き始めて２０年以上。その存在はドクター・ポールにとっても欠かせない。ドクター・ブレンダの活躍ぶりを紹介する。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 獣医ミシェルの日常 ９「獣医の子は獣医」[二]
programme.desc: ミシェルがコロナに感染し、シエラとマヤが臨時で診察することに。そこに鼻にトゲが刺さった犬や、脚に炎症を起こした犬がやって来る。果たして２人は対処できるのか。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 世界大自然紀行：スカンジナビア半島「タイガの魅力」声：宇賀なつみ[二]
programme.desc: スカンジナビア半島を覆う広大な森、タイガは、さまざまな野生動物の住みかだ。厳しい冬を生き延びるため、秋になると生き物たちは食料を蓄え、暖かな寝床を作る。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 喰らえ！捕食者の必殺ハンティング ２「北極の巨人：ホッキョクグマ」[二]
programme.desc: 地球上で最大のハンターであるホッキョクグマも、過酷な環境を生き抜くのに必死だ。特に獲物の少ない夏は飢えとの闘いだ。体力と知恵を駆使して獲物を仕留める。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: Ｄｒ．Ｋ エキゾチック動物専門医 ６「犬猿の仲！ ワタボウシタマリンを救え」
programme.desc: 元気に院内を走り回るやんちゃなワタボウシタマリン、体内に腫瘤のようなものができたヘビ、陰部の腫れた赤ちゃんリス、ギンギツネ、インコ、フェレットなどが登場【字幕】
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: スゴ腕どうぶつドクター １０「ポール動物病院は年中無休」[二]
programme.desc: ポール動物病院にはひっきりなしに患畜が訪れる。交通事故で骨盤を骨折した老犬や脚に重傷を負った馬は手の施しようがないように思えるが、最後まで諦めず治療する。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: カー・ＳＯＳ 蘇れ！思い出の名車６「インプレッサよ、不死鳥のごとく蘇れ！」[二]
programme.desc: オーナーの家族からの依頼を受け、ティムとファズはスバル・インプレッサを修復した。ところが、お披露目当日、車庫で火事が発生する！果たして、インプレッサの運命は？
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: カー・ＳＯＳ 蘇れ！思い出の名車８「珠玉のオースチン・ヒーレー３０００」[二]
programme.desc: 今回の車は戦後イギリスが生んだ珠玉のスポーツカー、オースチン・ヒーレー３０００。だが、ティムとファズの前に現れた車は、粗雑な修理と隠れた欠陥のオンパレードだった
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 【Ｄｒ．ポール・ハロウィーン】スゴ腕どうぶつドクター６「ハロウィーンの夜」[二]
programme.desc: 満月の夜に相次ぐ急患…。ウサギのエサを食べ過ぎた子羊、ヘルニアと糖尿病が同時に見つかったネコ、犬に攻撃されたブタ、飼い主の薬を飲んでしまった犬。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 【Ｄｒ．ポール・ハロウィーン】スゴ腕どうぶつドクター １１[二]
programme.desc: 「ハッピー・ニャロウィーン」赤ちゃんが生れないラブラドールのクージ、災難続きのゼウス、新入りの子ネコ、犬に襲われたミニブタ、瞬膜が破れたネコのモー。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: コロッセオ：死闘の娯楽とローマ帝国「享楽そして衰退」声：嶋村侑[二]
programme.desc: コロッセオがローマ帝国の衰退と滅亡に果たした役割とは何だろう？考古学者がオーストリア、チュニジア、ローマの遺跡を調査し、帝国が崩壊するまでの歴史を解き明かす。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: カー・ＳＯＳ 蘇れ！思い出の名車２「デンマークのボルボ・アマゾン」[二]
programme.desc: ２０１３年制作／今回番組は、初めて海を越えデンマークに向かった。救出するのは１９６８年製のボルボ・アマゾン。いずれ失明するというオーナーのために二人が奮闘する。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: カー・ＳＯＳ 蘇れ！思い出の名車２「悩めるエスコートＲＳ」[二]
programme.desc: ２０１３年制作／今回の車はエスコートＲＳ。オーナーはエイドリアン。修理するつもりで購入したが病気でできなくなった。車の状態は酷く、３週間では完成できそうにない。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 仰天！運び屋ｖｓ取締屋ｉｎ全米エアポート ８「国境に走る衝撃」[二]
programme.desc: メキシコから来た車の中に爆発物があり、国境検問所が一時封鎖される事態に。サンディエゴでは、捜査官がフェンタニルの仕入れ客に接触する危険なおとり捜査を行う。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: [4K]４Ｋプレミアムカフェ よみがえるバロックオペラ 南ボヘミア（２００２年）[字][再]
programme.desc: ハイビジョンスペシャル よみがえるバロックオペラ 〜南ボヘミア・古城修復物語〜（２００２年）２００年ぶりにオペラを復元した劇場で上演。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: [4K]いまよみがえる伝説の名演奏・名舞台 巨匠ベームの至芸[22.2][5.1][HDR][再]
programme.desc: ドイツで冷凍保存されていた歴史的名演を収めたネガフィルムを、８Ｋ／２２．２マルチチャンネルにリマスター。巨匠ベームによるリヒャルト・シュトラウスとシューベルト

programme.title: [4K]絶景に生きる野鳥たち 石垣島・西表島
programme.desc: サンゴ礁と亜熱帯の森が広がる島々の絶景。浜や密林、サトウキビ畑などで出会った多彩な鳥の愛らしい姿をたっぷり紹介。素敵な音楽とドローン映像などで心癒やされる１時間
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: [4K]さわやか自然百景映像集（１）御嶽山の森
programme.desc: 長野と岐阜の県境にそびえる御嶽山（おんたけさん）。岐阜県側の山腹を覆う森の魅力を「さわやか自然百景」で撮り溜めてきた極めつきの映像と心地よい音楽で紹介する。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: [4K]空からクルージング特別編 エーゲ海の島々[HDR]
programme.desc: エーゲ海に浮かぶ９つの島を訪ねる。空から眺める古代の街の遺跡は圧巻の姿、それが物語る島と人間の長い歴史、神話の舞台や中世の街並みも登場！
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: [4K]映像詩 千年続く祈りの風景
programme.desc: 奈良在住の映像作家・保山耕一さんが撮影した四季折々、祈りとともにあるやまとの風景。 【撮影】保山耕一 【音楽】川上ミネ、真砂秀朗
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: [4K]空港ピアノ「ノルウェー・オスロ ｖｏｌ．２」
programme.desc: ノルウェー・オスロの空港に置かれたピアノ。ショパンを熱演するピアニスト、ビートルズを愛するチリ人、陸軍の将校、スイス出身の数学者…どんな思いで曲を弾くのか
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: [4K]クラシック倶楽部 クンウー・パイク ピアノ・リサイタル[5.1]
programme.desc: ソウル生まれ。１５歳で米国に渡り、ジュリアード音楽院で学ぶ。１９６９年ブゾーニ国際ピアノコンクールで金賞。現在は、パリを拠点に世界の第一線で活躍を続けている。

programme.title: [4K]名曲アルバム「“エスタンシア”から“終幕の踊り”」[5.1][HDR]
programme.desc: 舞台はアルゼンチンの大平原。そこに暮らすのは、牛の群れを追う「ガウチョ」たち。作曲家ヒナステラは、何者にも束縛されず、誇り高く生きる彼らの姿を音楽に描き出した。

programme.title: [4K]【連続テレビ小説】どんど晴れ（１７）「おもてなしの心」[解][字]
programme.desc: 盛岡での仲居修業をはじめた夏美は、失敗を重ねながらも持ち前の明るさで仕事を覚えていく。しかし、夏美の不手際が原因で客が怪我をしてしまい、夏美は窮地に立たされる。

programme.title: [4K]【連続テレビ小説】ばけばけ第５週 ワタシ、ヘブン。マツエ、モ、ヘブン。２５[解][字]
programme.desc: 突如、部屋から出てこなくなったヘブン（トミー・バストウ）。学校に連れ出そうと駆けつけた錦織（吉沢亮）を見たトキは、ふとその後を追いかける。

programme.title: [4K]家族になろうよ 犬と猫と私たちの未来 たくましく 家族と一緒に[字]
programme.desc: 保護犬や保護猫が新しい家族と出会うお手伝いをする「家族になろうよ」。盲目の保護犬や路上で怪我を負った猫などを保護している施設の取り組みを見つめる。
programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: [4K]新日本風土記「大雪山麓 米どころ」[字][再]
programme.desc: 北海道・大雪山のふもと、人気の地域ブランド「東川米」の産地として知られる東川町。おいしい米を生む清らかな水の秘密、自然の中、豊かに暮らす人々の営みを見つめる。

programme.category: ドキュメンタリー／教養

programme.title: 最高の人生の見つけ方（2007年）◆ジャック・ニコルソン／モーガン・フリーマン◆
programme.desc: 余命６ヶ月と診断された男２人が残された時間で夢を追う姿を通じ、前向きに生きる素晴らしさを描く人間ドラマ。Ｊ・ニコルソンとＭ・フリーマンが共演。

programme.title: ピンク・キャデラック
programme.desc: クリント・イーストウッド主演の痛快アクション・コメディ。逃亡犯を追跡する賞金稼ぎが、ある女を捕えたことから騒動に巻き込まれていく。

programme.title: Ｄ−デイ：−１．０［マイナスワン］◆ＴＶ初放送◆
programme.desc: 第二次世界大戦の行方を決めた“ノルマンディー上陸作戦”。その前日を舞台に、史上最大の作戦を勝利に導いた男たちを描く戦争アクション。

programme.title: ウォンカとチョコレート工場のはじまり◆特集：チャーリーとチョコレート工場◆ＣＳ初
programme.desc: 『チャーリーとチョコレート工場』に登場したチョコレート工場の誕生秘話。ティモシー・シャラメが若き日のウィリー・ウォンカを演じるファンタジー。

programme.title: チャーリーとチョコレート工場◆特集：チャーリーとチョコレート工場◆
programme.desc: 世界中から選ばれた５人の子供が、ミステリアスなチョコレート工場の見学に訪れる、小説家ロアルド・ダールの名作を実写化した、ジョニー・デップ主演のファンタジー。

programme.title: 夢のチョコレート工場◆特集：チャーリーとチョコレート工場◆
programme.desc: 名優ジーン・ワイルダーが贈るファンタジー。世界中の子供たちを魅了するチョコレート工場を舞台に、子供たちが大冒険を繰り広げる。

programme.title: ＴＨＥ ＷＩＴＣＨ／魔女 −増殖−【日本語吹替版】
programme.desc: 『ＴＨＥ ＷＩＴＣＨ／魔女』と世界観を共有するバトル・アクション。名もなき少女を新たな主人公に据え、彼女の宿命をめぐる戦いを描く。

programme.title: ゴーストバスターズ（1984年）◆特集：ハロウィンナイト２０２５◆
programme.desc: ビル・マーレイ、ダン・エイクロイドの豪華共演で贈る大ヒットＳＦコメディ。３人の幽霊退治屋がニューヨークの幽霊を一掃する！

programme.title: ゴーストバスターズ２◆特集：ハロウィンナイト２０２５◆
programme.desc: 営業停止処分をうけていたゴーストバスターズが５年ぶりに再結成。ＮＹに現われた幽霊退治に挑む大人気シリーズ第２弾。主演はビル・マーレイ。

programme.title: ブギーナイツ
programme.desc: ポール・トーマス・アンダーソン監督の出世作となった群像ドラマ。１９７０年代後半〜８０年代を舞台に、アメリカン・ポルノ産業に従事する人々の姿を描く。

programme.title: 昼下りの決斗
programme.desc: サム・ペキンパー監督初期の傑作ウエスタン。ゴールドラッシュ期の米国を舞台に、金を護送する保安官一行と強盗団の闘いを描く。

programme.title: コードネーム Ｕ．Ｎ．Ｃ．Ｌ．Ｅ．
programme.desc: ガイ・リッチー監督が６０年代のＴＶシリーズ「００１１ナポレオン・ソロ」を映画化したアクション。米ソのスパイ・コンビが大規模テロの阻止に挑む。

programme.title: 戦略大作戦【吹替完全版】ムービープラスオリジナル◆声：山田康雄(多田野曜平）◆
programme.desc: クリント・イーストウッド、ドナルド・サザーランドが共演した戦争アクション。第二次世界大戦下のフランスで、金の延べ棒を奪うべく米軍小隊が奔走する！

programme.title: アメリカン・フライヤーズ◆黄金のベスト・ムービー：特集：スポーツの秋◆
programme.desc: 自転車レースで勝利を目指す兄弟がロッキー山脈を駆け抜ける！ジョン・バダム監督×ケヴィン・コスナー主演のヒューマン・ドラマ。

programme.title: グーニーズ
programme.desc: 落ちこぼれ少年団“グーニーズ”が、海賊が隠した宝探しの旅に出る！スティーヴン・スピルバーグ原案・製作総指揮の冒険ドラマ。

programme.title: ブレイド◆特集：ハロウィンナイト２０２５◆
programme.desc: ウェズリー・スナイプス主演のアクション・ホラー第１弾。人間とヴァンパイアの混血として生まれた主人公がスーパー・ヒーローとして活躍する！

programme.title: ブレイド２◆特集：ハロウィンナイト２０２５◆
programme.desc: ウェズリー・スナイプス主演のアクション・ホラー第２弾。人間とヴァンパイアの血を受け継ぐヴァンパイア・ハンターＶＳ死神族の戦いを描く。

programme.title: ★涼森れむ ＳＥＸ力を鍛えて差をつけろ エロ過ぎ小悪魔トレーナー
programme.desc: 小悪魔トレーナー・れむが、日々トレーニングに励む男性会員にエッチなご褒美をプレゼント♪ギンギンに勃起したチ●ポを口いっぱいに頬張り密着して跨ると…。

programme.title: ★水泳スクール見学ママ中●し 大人の巨乳を貪る男子たち
programme.desc: ターゲットは水泳スクールに見学に来ている巨乳ママ！年下の男子たちの悪戯で気づけば夢の中…。眠って起きない大人の巨乳に我慢できず大暴走！これがマセガキ達の悪行！

programme.title: ★ＭＭ便では口説けなかったＣＡが交渉の果てに最初で最後のＡＶ ＤＥＢＵＴ
programme.desc: Ｇカップ！１７０ｃｍ高身長！ＭＭ便で一度撮影を断られてからもずーっと口説いていた高嶺の花であるＣＡあすかさんが制服を着たままカメラの前で初中●しＳＥＸ！

programme.title: ★ＭＭ号 仲良しママ友対抗！童貞逆ナンパ射精バトル！４時間 ｐａｒｔ．５
programme.desc: シリーズ第５弾！これは寝取りなの！？より多くのザーメンを発射させた方が高●賞●ゲット！今回の奥様たちも若くて硬い童貞チ●ポを目の前に旦那を忘れて大発情！

programme.title: ★完全着衣 光沢サテンＯＬ 同僚のつるつるサテンに発情しちゃった俺
programme.desc: ツルツルサテンを着た同僚の胸の膨らみ、パンツラインが見えて抑えられない興奮！出張で会えなかった彼女が俺の大好きなサテンを着て待っててくれた。他１編収録！

programme.title: ★最初は無口だった内気な人妻が豹変！連続中●し！（仮名）スナオさん
programme.desc: シリーズ第４弾！“強い性欲だけが取り柄”の僕との待ち合わせにやって来たのはショートヘアの似合う見るからに真面目そうな人妻だったが、家に入るなり目付きが豹変し…。

programme.title: ★人気ＡＶ女優の凄テク早漏改善！素人男子が射精を我慢できたら…
programme.desc: 制限時間内に騎乗位で早漏チ●ポを３回射精させたら１００万●！男子は射精を我慢できたら…憧れの女優さんと夢の生ＳＥＸ！ご褒美ＳＥＸに辿り着ける猛者はいるのか！？

programme.title: ★固い女ほどエロい！熟女・人妻が過呼吸になるほどの濃密ＳＥＸ２０人３時間
programme.desc: ＳＥＸ下手な男性と結婚し、みこすり半で出されるＳＥＸしか知らないで生きてきた熟女が蛮勇をふるってＡＶ出演。たっぷりとイキまくり、最後に魅せる満足げな表情は必見。

programme.title: ★あどけない顔とは裏腹に超絶エッチな素人娘たちといちゃパコ無双！３時間
programme.desc: あどけない顔もそうですが、この年代ならではの髪や肌の質感にマニアな魅力が詰まってます。胸がつぼみです。青すぎる果実です。が、エロへの好奇心は全開なんです！

programme.title: ★色白デカ尻の家事代行おばさんに即ハメ！１ｓｔ ＢＥＳＴ４時間
programme.desc: デカ尻ファン必見！超人気シリーズのＢＥＳＴ作品集が遂に登場！自宅に呼んだ家事代行おばさんが色白で尻がデカくて美人で巨乳だったので…我慢できずにデカチンを即ハメ！

programme.title: ★義父に犯される巨乳妻たち４
programme.desc: 夫との性生活の不満は身体にずっと疼きを残しています。それを解消するのは…不思議なことにこの嫌悪感しかない義父が私に向ける汚らしくいやらしい目線だけなのです…。

programme.desc: French journalist and 'sento ambassador' Stephanie Crohin promotes sento, or public bathhouses, on social media - she tells Peter Barakan about her love for the heartwarming world of public baths.

programme.title: DOSUKOI Sumo Salon
programme.desc: NHK World-Japan presents a variety of short programmes focusing on Japan and Asia.

programme.title: Ramen Japan 5min.
programme.desc: A fantastic tale of love for local flavour set in Kurume, which is the birthplace of tonkotsu ramen.

programme.title: Ukiyo-e Edo-Life
programme.desc: Discover the story behind the 36 Views of Mount Fuji woodprint series. The Great Wave off Kanagawa by Hokusai is not just a huge wave, and the boat caught in the wave is there for a reason.

programme.title: Satoyama Kitchen
programme.desc: Chef Nobuko, her cameraman husband Makoto, and their cat Tama take us on a tasty journey of local cuisine served with a side of seasonal scenery at the Satoyama Kitchen guesthouse in Hida Takayama.

programme.title: Impacts: Climates Change the World
programme.desc: Global warming is impacting ecosystems and bird habitats in the World's mountainous regions. In the Japanese Alps, various efforts are underway to protect the endangered Japanese rock ptarmigan.

programme.title: Chatroom Japan
programme.desc: German urbanist Chris Dimmer focuses on the community-building potential of Japan's public bathhouses (sento) - he hopes that people living alone can rediscover the value of these bathhouses.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: The World Heritage Sites in Japan
programme.sub-title: The Ancient Prayers Transcending Time : Sacred Island of Okinoshima and Associated Sites
programme.desc: From natural landscapes to historic architecture representing centuries of cultural development, Japan's World Heritage sites offer a wide range of glimpses into history and the beauty of nature.

programme.title: YONEZAWA: Shirabu Onsen
programme.desc: A 700-year-old hot spring, Shirabu Onsen, is maintained via daily trips up the slopes of the 2,000-meter mountain where it sits. See the hot spring's guardian at work, in gorgeous time-lapse footage.

programme.title: Where We Call Home
programme.sub-title: Happiness Crafted with Needle and Thread
programme.desc: We meet two crafters of bespoke fashion in Tokyo - German Melanie Uematsu whose specialties include wedding gowns for non-Japanese customers, and Australian Thom O’Brien who creates handmade hats.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture. Here, the shishi symbolizes the harshness and bounty of the natural world, and the matsuri focuses on the importance of harmony between people and nature. Adults play the role of the enormous shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects. This event is also an opportunity for local families to wish for happy marriages and children, and the shishi dances in celebration.

programme.title: JAPAN DELISH
programme.desc: Crisp, hot and delicious Japanese gyoza! How did gyoza come to be so beloved in Japan? Taste the delicious truth for yourself!

programme.title: Nun's Cookbook
programme.desc: The temple chefs show us how to make su-no-mono with dried daikon radish. Just mix rehydrated daikon with red radish and sweet vinegar, and this tasty pink-colored dish is ready to serve.

programme.title: Hometown Stories
programme.sub-title: Chasing a Dream With a Horse
programme.desc: Nishino Masatoshi didn't know what he wanted to do with his life until he learned about horse logging. Now, he's chasing his dream in the forests of Hokkaido with the help of his trusty sidekick, Kap.

programme.title: Satoyama Kitchen Summer #5
programme.sub-title: Hot Days and Cool Nights Make Tasty Veggies
programme.desc: At the Satoyama Kitchen guesthouse in Hida Takayama, chef Nobuko, her cameraman husband Makoto and their cat Tama take us on a tasty journey of local cuisine served with a side of seasonal scenery.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Herbal Symphony
programme.desc: Autumn in Japan's oldest private medicinal herb garden in Uda, Nara Prefecture. As the plants bear fruit, the garden's custodians protect the seeds, ensuring that they live on for future generations.

programme.title: The Beauty of Japanese Swords: Famous Masterpieces
programme.desc: This time, two naginata (polearms) associated with legendary warriors: Benkei and Tomoe Gozen.

programme.title: Time-lapse Journey
programme.desc: Kyoto in the autumn: the old capital is even more beautiful when dressed in fall colors. Witness the contemplative and quiet beauty of Kyoto through time-lapse photography.

programme.title: Magical Japanese
programme.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode focuses on words related to doro, or mud. Since ancient times, Japanese people have gotten muddy in the rice paddies, cultivating their main staple. Perhaps because of this, there are a surprising number of expressions related to mud in Japanese. And reflecting such a place of hard work, many of them are used in business situations. From his home in Kyoto Prefecture, poet and literary translator Peter MacMillan guides us through unique words born from "mud."

programme.title: Easy Japanese
programme.desc: Learn how to say where you're from. The formula is the name of the place, followed by "kara kimashita".

programme.title: Culture Crossroads
programme.desc: In Edogawa City, where 40% of Tokyo's Indian population resides, a cultural exchange program gives Japanese residents the chance to visit Indian homes as well as facilities run by Indians.

programme.title: HELLO! NHK WORLD-JAPAN
programme.desc: Cycle Around Japan has teamed up with Taiwan's public broadcaster, PTS, for a three-part series airing this fall. Experience Taiwan's lush scenery, and meet guardians of traditional culture.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: CINEMATIC JOURNEY
programme.desc: Kyle Card hikes along the 1,000km trail following the Pacific Coast in northern Japan, where he discovers local lifestyles, stunning nature, traces of the area's 2011 disaster, and resilient people.

programme.title: The Masterpieces of Ukiyo-e producer Tsutaju
programme.sub-title: The Actor Otani Oniji III as Edobei
programme.desc: This miniseries presents the masterpieces of Tsutaju, a brilliant ukiyo-e producer of the Edo period. This episode spotlights artist Sharaku's debut work "The Actor Otani Oniji III as Edobei."

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.desc: Nakajima Hiromitsu makes supportive devices for world-class para-athletes such as gold medal-winning wheelchair tennis player Kamiji Yui. He talks about helping them perform at their best.

programme.title: DOSUKOI Sumo Salon
programme.desc: Only 7% of rikishi make it to the top division. We learn what kind of special perks such top-division rikishi receive, and hear how even some famous Yokozuna had inauspicious beginnings.

programme.title: The Beauty of Japanese Swords: Famous Masterpieces
programme.desc: This time, Yasutsuna, or Onikirimaru, a blade that was used to defeat a terrible demon.

programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE
programme.sub-title: The Series Summer Outfits by Kitagawa Utamaro
programme.desc: At dusk in summer, a woman is absorbed in reading a letter. This chic lady is actually an advertisement model for Mitsui Echigoya, one of the top kimono fabric stores in Edo.

programme.title: The Musical Diplomat: Playing a Bridge for Two Countries
programme.desc: Renowned pianist Lee Kyung-mi uses her talent to foster better ties between Japan and South Korea.

programme.title: Seasoning the Seasons
programme.desc: Traveling across Japan, we can find many bridges of all shapes and sizes. In Tokyo, building modern bridges was one way to join the club of advanced industrial nations in the late 19th century, when Japan was vying to catch up with Western technology. A small bridge in Iwate Prefecture is hand-made. Even if relatively few people use it, it is an important crossing for the local community. Today, we hear the story of bridges linking communities throughout Japan.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Herbal Symphony #5
programme.desc: In Uda, discover Japan's oldest private medicinal herb garden, where the natural landscape from 300 years ago is preserved in a botanical time capsule, a sanctuary of the local culture and history.

programme.title: YONEZAWA: Shirabu Onsen
programme.desc: A 700-year-old hot spring, Shirabu Onsen, is maintained via daily trips up the slopes of the 2,000-meter mountain where it sits. See the hot spring's guardian at work, in gorgeous time-lapse footage.

programme.title: Medical Frontiers
programme.sub-title: Exercise Is the Key to Surviving Cancer

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture. Here, the shishi symbolizes the harshness and bounty of the natural world, and the matsuri focuses on the importance of harmony between people and nature. Adults play the role of the enormous shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects. This event is also an opportunity for local families to wish for happy marriages and children, and the shishi dances in celebration.

programme.title: Nun's Cookbook
programme.desc: The temple chefs show us how to make su-no-mono with dried daikon radish. Just mix rehydrated daikon with red radish and sweet vinegar, and this tasty pink-colored dish is ready to serve.

programme.title: Where We Call Home
programme.sub-title: Happiness Crafted with Needle and Thread
programme.desc: We meet two crafters of bespoke fashion in Tokyo - German Melanie Uematsu whose specialties include wedding gowns for non-Japanese customers, and Australian Thom O’Brien who creates handmade hats.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Herbal Symphony
programme.desc: Autumn in Japan's oldest private medicinal herb garden in Uda, Nara Prefecture. As the plants bear fruit, the garden's custodians protect the seeds, ensuring that they live on for future generations.

programme.title: Time-lapse Journey
programme.desc: Kyoto in the autumn: the old capital is even more beautiful when dressed in fall colors. Witness the contemplative and quiet beauty of Kyoto through time-lapse photography.

programme.title: Magical Japanese
programme.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode focuses on words related to doro, or mud. Since ancient times, Japanese people have gotten muddy in the rice paddies, cultivating their main staple. Perhaps because of this, there are a surprising number of expressions related to mud in Japanese. And reflecting such a place of hard work, many of them are used in business situations. From his home in Kyoto Prefecture, poet and literary translator Peter MacMillan guides us through unique words born from "mud."

programme.title: Easy Japanese
programme.desc: Learn how to say where you're from. The formula is the name of the place, followed by "kara kimashita".

programme.title: Culture Crossroads
programme.desc: In Edogawa City, where 40% of Tokyo's Indian population resides, a cultural exchange program gives Japanese residents the chance to visit Indian homes as well as facilities run by Indians.

programme.title: HELLO! NHK WORLD-JAPAN
programme.desc: Cycle Around Japan has teamed up with Taiwan's public broadcaster, PTS, for a three-part series airing this fall. Experience Taiwan's lush scenery, and meet guardians of traditional culture.

programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: A week into the new year, giant torches are lit in a shrine precinct. The shadows they create enable a demon-oni-to go to a river and cleanse people of troubles. This is Oniyo: the night of the oni.

programme.title: Hometown Stories
programme.sub-title: Chasing a Dream With a Horse
programme.desc: Nishino Masatoshi didn't know what he wanted to do with his life until he learned about horse logging. Now, he's chasing his dream in the forests of Hokkaido with the help of his trusty sidekick, Kap.

programme.title: Journeys in Japan
programme.sub-title: SILK Road: Threads of History from Gunma to Yokohama
programme.desc: In 1859, when Japan reopened its doors after more than two centuries of isolation, goods flowed in and out of newly expanded ports. At the time, raw silk became the country's largest export, as the silk industries in France and Italy had been hit by an epidemic of silkworm disease. At one point, Japan was the world's biggest exporter. On this episode of Journeys in Japan, Sheila Cliffe from the UK follows the Silk Road from northern Kanto, once a major production area, to Yokohama, where the silk took off to the world.

programme.title: DEEPER LOOK
programme.sub-title: Charting the Future of the Olympics: David Wallechinsky / Co-Founder, International Society of Olympic Historians

programme.title: BOSAI: Science that Can Save Your Life
programme.desc: The Great East Japan Earthquake in 2011 and its resulting tsunami caused the accident at the Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant. The worst nuclear accident in Japan's history suffered from a lack of information due to the inaccessibility of the reactor buildings. For this reason, "disaster response robots" were deployed to take pictures and measure radiation doses inside the buildings. In the aftermath of a major disaster like that as well as an earthquake or fire, robots can quickly enter dangerous sites that are inaccessible to humans, find people in need of rescue, and take detailed measurements to provide data about the site. In this episode, we'll look at the latest developments among Japan's "disaster response robots."

programme.title: CYCLE AROUND JAPAN Highlights

programme.desc: In class, "u" continues to behave restlessly. Concerned, "i" uses the Heart Phone in the dream world to ask him why. In fact, "u" had been having difficulties because, to him, the light is too bright.

programme.title: Little Charo
programme.desc: Little Charo is an animation series about a Japanese dog who got lost in NY. "I want to see my owner again!" Charo starts his adventure back home.

programme.title: Japanology Plus mini
programme.desc: *First broadcast on November 2, 2025 Japan's plastic models are popular worldwide. Shizuoka City leads the nation in plastic model shipments. We look at the city's plastic model industry, from its history to the latest developments.

programme.title: A Cat's-Eye View of Japan
programme.desc: Photographer Iwago Mitsuaki reunites with cats from his past! He meets Kurobe, a temple cat, for the first time in six years. He then visits a seaside town to see Ponzu for the first time in twelve.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE

programme.title: Laugh Then Think: Japan's Offbeat Science
programme.desc: An electrified spoon can give a salty taste to foods, pleasing the palates of people on special diets. Miyashita Homei uses technology to recreate a variety of flavors that might reshape the future of food.

programme.title: Core Kyoto mini
programme.sub-title: Jidai Matsuri: A parade of period costumes through the ages
programme.desc: The festival on October 22 pays homage to Kyoto's 1200-year history with people parading in period costumes. Discover the citizens' resilience as they created a new Kyoto.

programme.title: Easy Japanese for Work
programme.sub-title: #40 Pointing out a senior coworker's mistake
programme.desc: Today: pointing out a senior coworker's mistake. Kyaw Swar Aung, from Myanmar, works behind the scenes at Narita Airport. He carries out tasks such as guiding aircraft as well as loading and unloading baggage. He's learned that both caution and precision are necessary to prevent accidents. He knows to report anything out of the ordinary, as well as any errors. He'll tackle a roleplay challenge in which he notices a senior worker's mistake. How will he handle the situation?

programme.title: Zero Waste Life
programme.desc: The Japanese southern island of Okinawa Prefecture, warm all year, this popular tourist spot is home to "Ryukyu Glass," a local industry for over 100 years. Glass blower Matsumoto Sakae insists on using discarded bottles as raw material. He says their status as trash inspires him to give them beauty, making things that will be loved and never again thrown away. Hoping, in some small way, to reduce waste in the world, he keeps his furnace hot and his tools ready.

programme.title: Somewhere Street
programme.desc: Bari is a port town located at the heel of the Italian peninsula. An important hub of commerce since the time of ancient Rome, it's known for welcoming people of diverse cultures from Asia and Africa.

programme.title: Chatroom Japan
programme.sub-title: The Local "Sento" - More Than a Bath
programme.desc: Have you ever been to a sento? Christian Dimmer, a German urbanist living in Japan, focuses on the community-building potential of Japan's public bathhouses. It is common these days in our society to live alone or in single-family units. He hopes that people can rediscover the value of the community communication nourished by public bathhouses.

programme.title: Seasoning the Seasons
programme.desc: Traveling across Japan, we can find many bridges of all shapes and sizes. In Tokyo, building modern bridges was one way to join the club of advanced industrial nations in the late 19th century, when Japan was vying to catch up with Western technology. A small bridge in Iwate Prefecture is hand-made. Even if relatively few people use it, it is an important crossing for the local community. Today, we hear the story of bridges linking communities throughout Japan.

programme.desc: Autumn in Japan's oldest private medicinal herb garden in Uda, Nara Prefecture. As the plants bear fruit, the garden's custodians protect the seeds, ensuring that they live on for future generations.

programme.title: The Beauty of Japanese Swords: Famous Masterpieces
programme.desc: This time, two naginata (polearms) associated with legendary warriors: Benkei and Tomoe Gozen.

programme.title: Time-lapse Journey
programme.desc: Kyoto in the autumn: the old capital is even more beautiful when dressed in fall colors. Witness the contemplative and quiet beauty of Kyoto through time-lapse photography.

programme.title: Where We Call Home
programme.sub-title: Happiness Crafted with Needle and Thread
programme.desc: We meet two crafters of bespoke fashion in Tokyo - German Melanie Uematsu whose specialties include wedding gowns for non-Japanese customers, and Australian Thom O’Brien who creates handmade hats.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: CINEMATIC JOURNEY
programme.desc: Kyle Card hikes along the 1,000km trail following the Pacific Coast in northern Japan, where he discovers local lifestyles, stunning nature, traces of the area's 2011 disaster, and resilient people.

programme.title: The Masterpieces of Ukiyo-e producer Tsutaju
programme.sub-title: The Actor Otani Oniji III as Edobei
programme.desc: This miniseries presents the masterpieces of Tsutaju, a brilliant ukiyo-e producer of the Edo period. This episode spotlights artist Sharaku's debut work "The Actor Otani Oniji III as Edobei."

programme.title: Magical Japanese
programme.desc: The Japanese language is rich in words and expressions influenced by nature, history and culture. This episode focuses on words related to doro, or mud. Since ancient times, Japanese people have gotten muddy in the rice paddies, cultivating their main staple. Perhaps because of this, there are a surprising number of expressions related to mud in Japanese. And reflecting such a place of hard work, many of them are used in business situations. From his home in Kyoto Prefecture, poet and literary translator Peter MacMillan guides us through unique words born from "mud."

programme.title: Easy Japanese
programme.desc: Learn how to say where you're from. The formula is the name of the place, followed by "kara kimashita".

programme.title: Culture Crossroads
programme.desc: In Edogawa City, where 40% of Tokyo's Indian population resides, a cultural exchange program gives Japanese residents the chance to visit Indian homes as well as facilities run by Indians.

programme.title: HELLO! NHK WORLD-JAPAN
programme.desc: Cycle Around Japan has teamed up with Taiwan's public broadcaster, PTS, for a three-part series airing this fall. Experience Taiwan's lush scenery, and meet guardians of traditional culture.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: The World Heritage Sites in Japan
programme.sub-title: The Ancient Prayers Transcending Time : Sacred Island of Okinoshima and Associated Sites
programme.desc: From natural landscapes to historic architecture representing centuries of cultural development, Japan's World Heritage sites offer a wide range of glimpses into history and the beauty of nature.

programme.title: YONEZAWA: Shirabu Onsen
programme.desc: A 700-year-old hot spring, Shirabu Onsen, is maintained via daily trips up the slopes of the 2,000-meter mountain where it sits. See the hot spring's guardian at work, in gorgeous time-lapse footage.

programme.title: Seasoning the Seasons
programme.desc: Traveling across Japan, we can find many bridges of all shapes and sizes. In Tokyo, building modern bridges was one way to join the club of advanced industrial nations in the late 19th century, when Japan was vying to catch up with Western technology. A small bridge in Iwate Prefecture is hand-made. Even if relatively few people use it, it is an important crossing for the local community. Today, we hear the story of bridges linking communities throughout Japan.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: Inami Shishimai is a type of lion dance performed in Toyama Prefecture. Here, the shishi symbolizes the harshness and bounty of the natural world, and the matsuri focuses on the importance of harmony between people and nature. Adults play the role of the enormous shishi while a child is the shishi-tori, whose job is to pacify the shishi with sacred objects. This event is also an opportunity for local families to wish for happy marriages and children, and the shishi dances in celebration.

programme.title: JAPAN DELISH
programme.desc: Crisp, hot and delicious Japanese gyoza! How did gyoza come to be so beloved in Japan? Taste the delicious truth for yourself!

programme.title: Nun's Cookbook
programme.desc: The temple chefs show us how to make su-no-mono with dried daikon radish. Just mix rehydrated daikon with red radish and sweet vinegar, and this tasty pink-colored dish is ready to serve.

programme.title: Hometown Stories
programme.sub-title: Chasing a Dream With a Horse
programme.desc: Nishino Masatoshi didn't know what he wanted to do with his life until he learned about horse logging. Now, he's chasing his dream in the forests of Hokkaido with the help of his trusty sidekick, Kap.

programme.title: Satoyama Kitchen Summer #5
programme.sub-title: Hot Days and Cool Nights Make Tasty Veggies
programme.desc: At the Satoyama Kitchen guesthouse in Hida Takayama, chef Nobuko, her cameraman husband Makoto and their cat Tama take us on a tasty journey of local cuisine served with a side of seasonal scenery.

programme.title: YONEZAWA: Shirabu Onsen

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.desc: Nakajima Hiromitsu makes supportive devices for world-class para-athletes such as gold medal-winning wheelchair tennis player Kamiji Yui. He talks about helping them perform at their best.

programme.title: DOSUKOI Sumo Salon
programme.desc: Only 7% of rikishi make it to the top division. We learn what kind of special perks such top-division rikishi receive, and hear how even some famous Yokozuna had inauspicious beginnings.

programme.title: The Beauty of Japanese Swords: Famous Masterpieces
programme.desc: This time, Yasutsuna, or Onikirimaru, a blade that was used to defeat a terrible demon.

programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE
programme.sub-title: The Series Summer Outfits by Kitagawa Utamaro
programme.desc: At dusk in summer, a woman is absorbed in reading a letter. This chic lady is actually an advertisement model for Mitsui Echigoya, one of the top kimono fabric stores in Edo.

programme.sub-title: Exercise Is the Key to Surviving Cancer

programme.title: Ama Divers Restoring the Seabed
programme.desc: Natural disasters devastated the fishing grounds of the ama (free divers) in Wajima in Noto Prefecture in 2024 - we follow their efforts to survey the seabed and revive their tradition.

programme.title: Direct Talk

programme.title: Impacts: Climates Change the World
programme.desc: Global warming is impacting ecosystems and bird habitats in the World's mountainous regions. In the Japanese Alps, various efforts are underway to protect the endangered Japanese rock ptarmigan.

programme.title: Rethinking Human Security/Africa
programme.desc: A focus on the panel discussion at TICAD 9 held in Yokohama, titled 'Human Security and Economic Development in Africa: Addressing Multidimensional Challenges and the Future Beyond 2030'.

programme.title: Design X Stories
programme.desc: Today's theme: Line Designs. These are evolving in many fields across Japan, from the traditional art of calligraphy to furniture and architecture - explore a truly diverse world of line designs.

programme.title: Asia Insight
programme.desc: In Yiwu in China, the Muslim Hui people expand trade with Arab countries using their Arabic language skills; they are becoming an essential presence as China shifts away from US trade and diversifies.

programme.title: Matsuri: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: In September, 11 districts in Yatsuo in Toyama Prefecture parade along different routes performing Etchu Owara-Kaze-no-Bon, a 300-year-old matsuri that features elegant music, dancing, and singing.

programme.title: Take Tech
programme.desc: A programme for upper primary to lower secondary school children about exploring everyday technologies all around them - each episode takes a piece of familiar tech and finds out what it does and how.
